intro: Galeopsis dubia, commonly known as the lesser hedge-nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom from June to August. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Galeopsis dubia is characterized by its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin.
